summary.p: An incomplete copy (455 stanzas) of the Aññavataipparaṇi by Tattuvarāyar.
The chapter entitled cum mulakkai is announced by an in-text intertitle at the end, but the text stops short there.
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (February 2021).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

collation.desc: 25 folios = Tiruvāmāttūr Kalampakam: Text. Original Tamil foliation 1-18 only. Library foliation 1-24, 25 (crossed-out), [26-35]. f25, f[26-35] blank recto verso.

supportDesc.condition: Relatively poor state of preservation. Some moisture/water damages, cracked leaves.

additions.desc: Shelfmark Cc/3 in black ink on a sticker (spine).
Title printed in golden letters Aññvataippaṟaṇi (spine).
BnF shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 365 (front cover, recto).
BnF shelfmark in black pencil: Tamoul N° 365 (f[1]r).

origin.origDate: No internal date. Dated to circa 1770 by Vinson in Vinson et al. (1866-) and t0 1770 by Cabaton (1912), on unstated grounds (presumably palaeographical and material analysis arguments). Not after 1854, since part of the collection of Édouard Ariel (1818-1854), bequeathed in 1855 to the Société Asiatique, Paris (Rosny 1868).

provenance.p: Owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequeathed by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. — See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 53, no. 365.
Rosny, Léon de. 1868. La bibliothèque tamoule de M. Ariel, de Pondichéry. In: Variétés orientales (pp. 177‒224). Paris: Maisonneuve.
Vinson, Julien & Feer, Léon & s.n. 1866-. Catalogue des manuscrits tamoul et télinga. Manuscript, BnF Indien 577. — See f. 82r, no. 337 363.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.

revisionDesc.change: Revised by Emmanuel FRANCIS. Version 1, May 2022.
